member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Window.C1Window
member.summary: Represents a dialog window.
member.remarks:
C1Window is a pop-up window can be used to display a message, ask for confirmation, user input and so on.
C1Window has Client-Side Object Model (CSOM) that mostly repeats the Server-Side Object Model. This means methods and read or write properties may be called on the client side like on the server side.
To access CSOM, use this syntax: <ClientID>.control.
The example below demonstrates how to get and show a dialog window via JavaScript.
<script type="text/javascript"> var dialog = $get("C1Window1").control; dialog.show(); </script>
By default C1Window is hidden on the Page. To get a dialog window to be visible on load, set the ShowOnLoad to True.
There are two modes of dialog boxes: modal and modeless. To show a dialog in modeless mode call show(), to show a dialog in modal mode call showModal().
C1Window requires that Microsoft AJAX Extentions be installed and a ScriptManager is on the page. Microsoft AJAX Extentions can be found at http://ajax.asp.net/. For more information about Microsoft ASP.NET AJAX Extensions, see Microsoft's ASP.Net AJAX Web site.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Window.C1Window.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for the content area of the control.
member.remarks:
Use the ContentTemplate property to control the contents of the dialog window.
To specify a template for the dialog, reset the property, place the <ContentTemplate> tags between the opening and closing tags of the control. You can then list the contents of the template between the opening and closing <ContentTemplate> tags.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar
member.summary: C1Toolbar is an ASP.NET control that is used as a container to hold other controls such as buttons, check buttons, text boxes, drop-down lists, split-buttons, and separators. C1ToolBar provides six different objects to support the various types of controls used in the C1ToolBar: C1ToolBarGroup, C1ToolBarButton, C1ToolbarDropDownList, C1ToolbarCheckButton, C1ToolbarSplitButton, and C1ToolBarSeparator.

member.summary: Fires when the toolbar item's property changed.

member.name: E:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.ItemCheck
member.summary: Fires when the check state of an item changes.
member.remarks:
The CheckBoxes property must be set to true in order for check boxes to be displayed. This event will only be fired when a checkbox button item is checked. If the CheckOnClick property is set to true, user clicks the checkbox button will trigger this client side event and when the AutoPostBack property is set to true, page will post back to the server and then this server side event will be fired.
If the CheckOnClick property is set to true, user presses the access key will also trigger this client side event and when the AutoPostBack property is set to true, page will post back to the server and then this server side event will be fired.
If the CheckOnClick property is set to false, only when user clicks the checked area before text will trigger this client side event and when the AutoPostBack property is set to true, page to post back to the server and then this event will be fired.

member.name: E:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.ItemClick
member.summary: Occurs when a ToolBar item in a C1ToolBar control is clicked.
member.remarks: Use this event to determine which C1ToolBarItem was clicked. This event is triggered before the Click event. The standard Click event is generated if the mouse is clicked on any party of the C1ToolBar control. The ItemClick event is generated only when the mouse is clicked on the text or image of a C1ToolBarIItem object.

member.name: E:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.ItemSelect
member.summary: Fires when an item is selected.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.AllowDrag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the toolbar control can be dragged to rearrange its position.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.AllowMultipleSelectInControl
member.summary: If false, only a single item can be selected in the all of the groups in the control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.AccessKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the access key that allows you to quickly navigate to the Web server control.
member.remarks: Use the AccessKey property to specify the keyboard shortcut for the Web server component. This allows you to navigate quickly to the component by pressing the ALT key and the key for the specified character on the keyboard. For example, setting the access key of a component to the string "D" indicates that the user can navigate to the component by pressing ALT+D.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.VisualStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual style name that determines the overall appearance of the control.
member.remarks: This property allows you to quickly customize the appearance of the ToolBar so it matches the appearance of your application. The settings available include ArcticFox which is the default value, Office2007Black, Office2007Blue, Office2007Silver, Vista, and VistaBlack.

member.remarks: Default value is false.

member.summary: The count of selected items. The property is hidden.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.ScrollSettings
member.summary: Specifies the type of scroll settings that can be used on the C1Toolbar.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the scroll button types, scroll button position, scroll content height and width, scroll button orientation, and scroll step.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.Dock
member.summary: Defines which borders of the control are bound to the container.
member.remarks: Use the C1ToolBar.Dock property to define how a toolbar is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. For example, setting dock to Left causes the toolbar to align itself with the left edges of its parent control and to resize as the parent control is resized.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBar.DockMode
member.summary: Specifies the position and manner in which a control is docked.
member.remarks: Use the C1ToolBar.DockMode property to define the docking behavior of a toolbar control. By default, if the control is dragged over a C1ToolBarContainer control and the mouse is released, then the control will be docked to the left edge of the C1ToolBarContainer.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarButton
member.summary: Represents an ASP.NET toolbar button. The C1ToolBarButton object defines a toolbar button.
member.remarks: A button can include text, image, or text and image. Set text with the Text property, and an image with the Image property for each C1ToolBarButton object. The buttons can be added at design-time using the designer, programmatically using Add or Remove methods from the C1ToolBarItemCollection collection, or on the client-side by using the removeAt client-side method.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarItem
member.summary: The C1ToolBarItem object represents link type items and provides the following three properties specific to link items: NavigateUrl property, Target property, and Text property. All toolbar items and child toolbar items are stored in the Items collection. C1ToolBar items can be a link item, button item, list item, group item, or separator item.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarItem.CommandArgument
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional parameter passed to the ItemClick and ItemSelected events of the component along with the associated CommandName.
member.remarks: Use the CommandArgument property to specify a parameter that complements the CommandName property. The CommandArgument property complements the CommandName property by allowing you to provide additional information about the command to perform. For example, if you set the CommandName property to Sort and the CommandArgument property to Ascending, you specify a command to sort in ascending order.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarItem.CommandName
member.summary: Gets or sets the command name associated with the Item passed to the ItemClick and ItemSelected events of the component.
member.remarks: When you have multiple C1ToolBarButton items in the control use the CommandName property to specify the command name associated with each C1ToolBarButton item. You can set the CommandName property with any string that identifies the command to perform. You can then programmatically determine the command name of the C1ToolBarButton item and perform the appropriate actions.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarCheckButton
member.summary: C1ToolBarCheckButton defines a toolbar check button on a toolbar.
member.remarks: By default, the C1ToolBarCheckButton includes an image for the rectangular box and text that indicates a choice a user can make by selecting the button. Check buttons enable users to choose from one or more options that are not mutually exclusive. The C1ToolBarCheckButton changes between two states when clicked.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of items when the dropdown button is clicked. Every item is a C1ToolBarButton.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.ExpandAnimation
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of expand animation effect.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the animation effect when the user opens the dropdown object.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.ExpandDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation duration.
member.remarks: This property can be used to specify how long the dropdown items in the C1ToolBar will be open.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.ExpandDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the expand delay in milliseconds before the sub toolbar item starts to popup. The default value is 100ms.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.CollapseAnimation
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of collapse animation effect.
member.remarks: The collapse animation effect occurs while the dropdown items in the C1ToolBar close.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.CollapseDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation duration.
member.remarks: This property can be used to specify how long the dropdown items in the C1ToolBar will be hidden.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.CollapseDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the collapse delay in milliseconds before the sub toolbar item starts hiding. Default value is 100ms.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.CollapseEasing
member.summary: Gets or sets the transition effect when the dropdown toolbar items start collapsing or stops collapsing.
member.remarks: To use a transition effect, the CollapseAnimation or ExpandAnimation property must be set to an animation type before you set the CollapseEasing property or ExpandEasing property. The default transition effect is EaseLinear. This effect moves smoothly from start to end without acceleration or deceleration.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolBar.C1ToolBarDropDownBase.ExpandEasing
member.summary: Gets or sets the transition effect when the dropdown toolbar items start expanding or stops expanding.
member.remarks: To use a transition effect, the CollapseAnimation or ExpandAnimation property must be set to an animation type before you set the CollapseEasing property or ExpandEasing property. The default transition effect is EaseLinear. This effect moves smoothly from start to end without acceleration or deceleration.

member.summary: Gets the index of selected item.

member.summary: Gets the index of selected items.

member.remarks: C1ToolBarGroups are typically used when a group of functions are mutually exclusive. That is, only one of the functions represented by the group of buttons can be on at a time.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the C1ToolBarSeparator class.
member.remarks: The separator appears as a solid or dashed vertical line for horizontal toolbars and a horizontal line for vertical toolbars. Proper use of separators can help chunk the information on a toolbar and make it easier to memorize. You can define a new line image for the C1ToolBarSeparator using its CSS selectors.

member.summary: Determines whether to display the calendar title.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Calendar.C1Calendar.CalendarTitle
member.summary: Determines the string that displays on calendar title.
member.remarks:
CalenderTitle is the group tile shared by all the month views. To change the title for month views, you have to use MonthViewTitle property.
The title string can be any string or string that has date formatting parameters.
At most four parameters are accepted, each can has its own data format. They are: {0} - The value of DiaplayDate. {1} - The first month of month views, when multiple monthes are displayed. {2} - The last month of month views, when multiple monthes are displayed. {3} - The number of month views, when multiple monthes are displayed.
For example: "Schedule of {0:MMMM yyyy}". "{1:MMMM yyyy} to {2:MMMM yyyy}"

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Calendar.C1Calendar.MonthViewTitle
member.summary: Determines the string that displays on month view title.
member.remarks:
MonthViewTitle is the tile display on each month view. To change the top most group title shared by month views, you have to use CalendarTitle property.
The title string can be any string or string that has date formatting parameters.
At most four parameters are accepted, each can has its own data format. They are: {0} - The value of DiaplayDate. {1} - The first month of month views, when multiple monthes are displayed. {2} - The last month of month views, when multiple monthes are displayed. {3} - The number of month views, when multiple monthes are displayed.
For example: "Schedule of {0:MMMM yyyy}". "{1:MMMM yyyy} to {2:MMMM yyyy}"

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Calendar.C1Calendar.CustomDays
member.summary: Gets the collection of custom days.
member.remarks:
You can specify custom styles for specific calendar day by defining CustomDay.
C1WebCalendar supports hosting templates in calendar day cells.
To add template controls, you have to: 1. Click the ellipsis button right beside the DayTemplates in property grid to open the DayTemplates collection editor. 2. Add template to this collection, give proper ID. 3. Select "Edit Templates" in smart tag.
To "bind" template to a calendar day, you have to: 1. Click the ellipsis button right beside the CustomDays in property grid. 2. Add CustomDay in this collection. 3. Specify the TemplateID and Date property. The TemplateID should be the ID of template added in the above steps.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Calendar.C1Calendar.DayTemplates
member.summary: Gets the template collection.
member.remarks:
C1WebCalendar supports hosting templates in calendar day cells.
To add template controls, you have to: 1. Click the ellipsis button right beside the DayTemplates in property grid to open the DayTemplates collection editor. 2. Add template to this collection, give proper ID. 3. Select "Edit Templates" in smart tag.
To "bind" template to a calendar day, you have to: 1. Click the ellipsis button right beside the CustomDays in property grid. 2. Add CustomDay in this collection. 3. Specify the TemplateID and Date property. The TemplateID should be the ID of template added in the above steps.

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeBase.RoundValueToSnaps(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the number nearest 'value' that is the multiple of the specified snapping interval ('snapInterval').
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapping interval is expected to be in logarithmic coordinates.

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeBase.RoundValueToSnaps(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the number nearest 'value' that is the multiple of the specified snapping interval ('snapInterval') counting from the given origin ('snapOrigin').
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapInterval and snapOrigin values are expected to be in logarithmic coordinates.

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeBase.IncValueToSnaps(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Rounds the value to the next intervalsCount'th (first, second, etc.) multiple of the specified snapping interval ('snapInterval').
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapInterval value is expected to be in logarithmic coordinates.

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeBase.IncValueToSnaps(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Rounds the value to the next intervalsCount'th (first, second, etc.) multiple of the specified snapping interval ('snapInterval'). The snapOrigin parameter specifies the point of origin for snapping.
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapInterval and snapOrigin values are expected to be in logarithmic coordinates.

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugePointer.UpdateValue(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the pointer's with the number nearest 'newValue' that is the multiple of the snapping interval ('snapInterval').
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapping interval is expected to be in logarithmic coordinates. If not, the 'snapInterval' parameter must be in the same scale as the pointer's .

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugePointer.UpdateValue(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the pointer's with the number nearest 'newValue' that is the multiple of the snapping interval ('snapInterval') counting from the given origin ('snapOrigin').
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapInterval and snapOrigin values are expected to be in logarithmic coordinates. If not, these values must be in the same scale as the pointer's .

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugePointer.IncValue(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Increments the pointer's to the next intervalsCount'th (first, second, etc.) multiple of the snapping interval ('snapInterval').
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapping interval is expected to be in logarithmic coordinates. If not, the 'snapInterval' parameter must be in the same scale as the pointer's .

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugePointer.IncValue(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Increments the pointer's to the next intervalsCount'th (first, second, etc.) multiple of the snapping interval ('snapInterval'). The snapOrigin parameter specifies the point of origin for snapping.
member.remarks: If the Gauge uses logarithmic scale the snapInterval and snapOrigin values are expected to be in logarithmic coordinates. If not, these values must be in the same scale as the pointer's .

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation
member.summary: Specifies how the source and given clipping regions can be combined.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation.None
member.summary: The source region remains unchanged.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation.Replace
member.summary: The source clipping region is replaced by the given region.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation.Intersect
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking their intersection.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation.Union
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking the union of both.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation.Xor
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking only the areas enclosed by one or the other region, but not both.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation.Exclude
member.summary: Specifies that the source region is replaced by the result of the given region being removed from the source region.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeClipOperation.Complement
member.summary: Specifies that the source region is replaced by the result of the source region being removed from the given region.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.LightUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points and are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, but they are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.DarkDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than, and are twice the width of ForwardDiagonal. This hatch pattern is not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.DarkUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, and are twice its width, but the lines are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.WideDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as hatch style ForwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.WideUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as hatch style BackwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.LightVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.LightHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.NarrowVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than hatch style Vertical (or 25 percent closer together than LightVertical).

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.NarrowHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than hatch style Horizontal (or 25 percent closer together than LightHorizontal).

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.DarkVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical and are twice its width.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.DarkHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal and are twice the width of Horizontal.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.DashedDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies dashed diagonal lines, that slant to the right from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.DashedUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies dashed diagonal lines, that slant to the left from top points to bottom points.

member.summary: Specifies dashed horizontal lines.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1GaugeHatchStyle.DashedVertical
member.summary: Specifies dashed vertical lines.

member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.
So the solution is this:

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Nag(System.Type,C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Nag user by showing AboutBox with license information. Show it only once per day per assembly.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
object that contains information about the license.
Whether we're running at design or run time.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object.
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
Any valid C1 runtime key.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ValidateDesigntime(System.Type,System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext)
member.summary: Design time validation. Looks for a license in the registry and saves it in the provided .
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
where the runtime key will be stored.
member.returns: A with information about the license.
member.remarks: Call this method from application-type products (that always require a license to be installed in the registry). In this case, the parameter should be set to null.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ValidateRuntime(System.Type,System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext)
member.summary: Runtime validation. Looks for a runtime key stored in the current application's resources.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
where the runtime key will be stored.
member.returns: A with information about the license.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.SafeLicenseContext
member.summary:
Provides a version of GetSavedLicenseKey that doesn't require special permissions.
The code was mostly copied from the .NET framework, but then changed in a few places to require fewer permissions (assembly name, file io, etc).
The main change is the use of a custom deserializer to read Hashtable objects instead of the original BinaryFormatter, which requires permissions.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.ProductLicense
member.summary:
Represents a license for a product (e.g. C1BarCode, C1Studio Enterprise).
Provides methods for: - generating new license keys (administrative task) - checking license key validity (used by installer and products) - generating and checking runtime keys (used by products) - installing/uninstalling licenses (used by installer)
The install/uninstall code requires elevated permissions, and is used only by setups and utilities (not by controls). The code is implemented in the ProductLicense.Installer.cs, which controls should not include since it won't be useful to them.
When a product is sold, we send the user a license KEY. The user installs a license on his machine by providing his name, his company name, and the key.
The is a string in the following format:
AAQYYCC-XX-NNNNNN-DD-DZZZZZZ
Where:
AA: Product code (should match one of the products in the product catalog (see ProductInformation.GetProductCatalog()). Q: Quarter when the license key was issued (1, 2, or 3) YY: Year when the license key was issued (e.g., 10 for 2010) CC: Order code, two chars that indicate whether this is a new sale, upgrade, renewal, special offer, etc. XX: Hash code to ensure key validity. NNNNNN: Unique serial number. DDD: Vendor code, three chars ZZZZZZ: Combination of random numbers for uniqueness and extra hash.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.ImageRenderMethod
member.summary: Indicates the method by which the HTML image tag source URL is rendered.
member.remarks: For more information, see the ImageRenderMethod Property topic.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.ImageTransferMethod
member.summary: Indicates the method by which image data is transferred to the source page.
member.remarks: When a secondary URL is used to stream image data back to an tag on the primary page, it is necessary to transfer the guage data through either a session object, cache object, or a file.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.ImageIdGeneration
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of uniqueness of the ID transfer object.

remarks.para: When guage data is transferred from one page to another, IDs are created for the Session or Cache variables or for a filename in order to render a guage image. This property determines whether a unique ID is created each time the guage image is accessed (i.e. when the guage image is accessed by a single user), or if the same ID is to be used for the duration of the application life (i.e. when the identical guage image is accessed by multiple users or accessed repeatedly by a single user).
Note: The ImageIdGeneration property has no effect with the ImageRenderMethodEnum.File or ImageRenderMethodEnum.BinaryWrite.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.ImageUri
member.summary: Specifies a path for various render methods.
member.remarks: This property specifies a pathname. It has different applications for different properties and settings. For more information, see ImageRenderMethod Property. Also refer to File-based Rendering Tutorials, HTTPHandler-based Rendering Tutorials, and ASP Page-based Rendering Tutorials.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.AbsoluteExpiration
member.summary: Specifies the absolute expiration time when the image expires from the session, cache, or file object.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.ImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the Image format to be used for the client side image.
member.remarks: Note that while this property accepts a .Net ImageFormat value, the only image formats available to the C1Gauge programmer are gif, jpeg, and png.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.ImageQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the image quality created when the ImageFormat is set to jpeg.
member.remarks: This property accepts an integer from 0 to 100 which specifies the quality of the jpeg image file.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.C1Gauge.SlidingExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between the time the image was last accessed and the time when the image expires from the session, cache, or file object.
member.remarks: If this value is the equivalent of 5 minutes, the image expires and is removed from the transfer object 5 minutes after it was last accessed.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageIdGeneration
member.summary:
Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the
property in the C1Gauge class.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageIdGeneration.Unique
member.summary: Unique ID is created each time the chart image is accessed.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageIdGeneration.Application
member.summary: The same ID is to be used for the duration of the application life.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageRenderMethod
member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the property in the C1Gauge class.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageRenderMethod.File
member.summary: C1Gauge will generate image files that can be referenced directly by an tag. The tag will be generated and will reference the file specified by the ImageUri property. If the ImageUri property is not specified, then a name for the temporary file will be generated and the URL will reference the temporary file.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageRenderMethod.HttpHandler
member.summary: C1Gauge supports the IHTTPHandler interface and will generate an appropriately placed tag within the page that references its internal HTTPHandler to stream the image to the client.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageRenderMethod.BinaryWrite
member.summary: C1Gauge will perform a binary write to its host page response stream directly, without transferring data to another page. However, the binary image data will be the only data returned.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageRenderMethod.AspPage
member.summary: C1Gauge will utilize a secondary asp(x) page to stream the image data back to an imbedded tag on the primary page. If this option is selected, the chart will generate an appropriately placed tag within the page that hosts the chart. The positioning of the tag will be in the same location as shown on the Visual Studio design page, and tag src attribute will reference the specified asp(x) page. The path to the page will be that specified by the ImageUri property.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageRenderMethod.Manual
member.summary: C1Gauge does nothing to render itself at runtime. All operations required for generating and placing the chart image within the page are the responsibility of the programmer.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageTransferMethod
member.summary:
Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the
property in the C1WebChart class.

member.summary: Image is transferred in a session object.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageTransferMethod.Cache
member.summary: Image is transferred in a cache object.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageTransferMethod.File
member.summary: Image is transferred in a file.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Gauge.ImageTransferMethod.None
member.summary: Image is not transferred.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowColSizing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether columns can be sized on the client.
member.remarks: This property allows column sizing on the client. For this property to work correctly you need to set the width of the component to 0px and optionally set the width of each column using the Property builder.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowKeyboardNavigation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether keyboard navigation is enabled.
member.remarks: When this property is turned on you can use keys such as arrows, PgDown, PgUp, Home, End or Tab for changing position of the current cell.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowCustomPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether custom paging is enabled.

remarks.para: Set this property to True to enable custom paging.

Paging allows you to display the contents of the component in page segments. To enable custom paging, set both the and AllowCustomPaging properties to True. Next, provide code to handle the event. Create a data source that contains the data to display on a single page and then use the method to bind the data to the component.

Because only a segment of the data is loaded, you must set the property to the total number of items in the component. This allows the control to determine the total number of pages needed to display every item in the component. This property is normally programmatically set once the total number of items in the component is determined.

When paging is enabled with the AllowCustomPaging property set to False, the component assumes that the data source contains all the items to be displayed. The component calculates the indexes of the items on the displayed page based on the page index, specified by the property, and the number of items on a page, specified by the property.

When the AllowCustomPaging property is set to True, the component assumes that the data source only contains the items as determined by the property. All items up to the number of items specified by the property are displayed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowGrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether grouping is enabled.
member.remarks: This property allows your end users to drag column headers into the grouping area of the grid. This property only works if is set to False and is True. You should provide code in the event.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether paging is enabled.
member.remarks: Set this property to True to display the contents of the component in page segments. You should provide code to handle the event.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether sorting is enabled.
member.remarks: Set this property to True to enable sorting.

member.summary: Determines if partial or full update of grid's HTML content will take place during callback.
member.remarks: Partial rendering is used with callbacks. When enabled, server sends only necessary HTML code portions to a client as a result of callback thus performing smart update. Partial rendering is used for edit, update, cancel, select actions, group expanding and virtual scrolling. If for any reason you need full update of HTML code, set this property to false.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.OptimizeDataOnlyRendering
member.summary: Determines if data-only or full update of grid's HTML content will take place during callback.
member.remarks: Data-only rendering is used with callbacks. When enabled, server sends only necessary data or HTML code portions to a client as a result of callback thus performing smart update. Data-only rendering is used for page, sort, delete, filter. If for any reason you need full or partial update of HTML code, set this property to false.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1BoundField.DataFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that specifies the display format for items in the column.
member.value: This property is used to provide a custom format for the items in the column.

remarks.para: The data format string consists of two parts, separated by a colon, in the form {A:Bxx}. For example, the formatting string, {0:D2}, would format the cell to display a number with two decimal places.
Note: The entire string must be enclosed in curly braces to denote that it is a format string and not a literal string. Any text outside the curly braces is displayed as literal text.
The value before the colon (A in the general example) specifies the parameter index in a zero-based list of parameters.
Note: This value can only be set to 0 because there is only one value in each cell.
The character after the colon (B in the general example) specifies the format to display the value in. The following table lists the common formats.

ul.li: C - Displays numeric values in currency format.
D - Displays numeric values in decimal format.
E - Displays numeric values in scientific (exponential) format.
F - Displays numeric values in fixed format.
G - Displays numeric values in general format.
N - Displays numeric values in number format.
X - Displays numeric values in hexadecimal format.

remarks.para: Note: The format character is not case-sensitive, except for X, which displays the hexadecimal characters in the case specified.
The value after the format character (xx in the general example) specifies the number of significant digits or decimal places to display the value in.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1BoundField.FilterCustomOperator
member.summary: Gets or sets value that will be used as filter operator when the property is equal to the value.
member.value: The default value is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: The string can be any literal string and can contain two placeholders: name and current value.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.C1BoundField.FilterOperator

member.returns: The object that contains the changes to the view state of the .

member.name: M:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.TrackViewState
member.summary: Causes the object to track changes to its state so that it can be persisted across requests.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.Position
member.summary: Determines whether the control should insert group header and/or group footer rows for this column.
member.value: One of the values. The default value is .

remarks.para:
Set value to to disable grouping for the column. Set to , or
to create groups and define the position of the group rows.

To group by a column, remember to sort the data on the column. The grid inserts group header and footer rows whenever the value being grouped on changes. If you don't sort the data, there will be a lot of group header and footer rows.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.OutlineMode
member.summary: Determines whether the user will be able to collapse and expand the groups by clicking on the group headers, and also determines whether groups will be initially collapsed or expanded.
member.value: One of the values. The default value is .

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.CollapsedImageUrl
member.summary: Determines the images used to show collapsed nodes on the grid.
member.remarks: By default, these properties are set to images that look like the '+' and '-' icons used in TreeView controls. You can select your own images, and even use different images for different groups.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.ExpandedImageUrl
member.summary: Determines the images used to show expanded nodes on the grid.
member.remarks: By default, these properties are set to images that look like the '+' and '-' icons used in TreeView controls. You can select your own images, and even use different images for different groups.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.GroupSingleRow
member.summary: Determines whether groupings containing a single row are grouped.
member.value: If False, groupings which contain a single row will not be grouped. The default value is True.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.HeaderText
member.summary: Determines the text that is displayed in the group header rows.

remarks.para: The text may include up to two placeholders: "{0}" is replaced with the value being grouped on and "{1}" is replaced with the group's column header
The text may also include HTML tags which you can use to add formatting commands.
The text may be set to "Custom". Doing so causes the event to be raised when processing a grouped header.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.FooterText
member.summary: Determines the text that is displayed in the group footer rows.

remarks.para: The text may include up to two placeholders: "{0}" is replaced with the value being grouped on and "{1}" is replaced with the group's column header
The text may also include HTML tags which you can use to add formatting commands.
The text may be set to "Custom". Doing so causes the event to be raised when processing a grouped footer.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.FooterStyle
member.summary: Determines the style used to render group header and footer rows.
member.remarks: This style is based on the grid's property. If you are grouping on a single column, you probably won't have to change this style. If you are creating several levels of grouping, however, you will usually set the BackColor and ForeColor of each group header/footer to a different value to emphasize the structure of the data.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1GridView.GroupInfo.HeaderStyle
member.summary: Determines the style used to render group header rows.
member.remarks: This style is based on the grid's property. If you are grouping on a single column, you probably won't have to change this style. If you are creating several levels of grouping, however, you will usually set the BackColor and ForeColor of each group header/footer to a different value to emphasize the structure of the data.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput
member.summary: The main Web control used for entering and editing information of any data type in a text form. Supports data formatting, edit mask, data validation and other features. Supports formatted and masked editing of all data types, including additional functionality. Apart from being the main data editor control, C1MaskedInput also serves as the base class for specialized controls such as C1DateInput and C1NumericInput.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1InputBase.Culture
member.summary: CultureInfo object. Each culture has different conventions for displaying dates, time, numbers, currency, and other information. Neutral cultures are not supported.
member.remarks:
Returning value can be null if Culture is not defined.
The CultureInfo class specifies a unique name for each culture, based on the RFC 3066 standard for Windows Vista and later, and the RFC 1766 standard for pre-Windows Vista operating systems. The name is a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code associated with a country or region.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.AllowPromptAsInput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether PromptChar can be entered as valid data by the user.
member.remarks: Even when AllowPromptAsInput is true, the prompt character must be valid for the current location in the mask in order to be accepted. For example, if PromptChar is "*", and the current location in the mask demands the user enter a digit, entering an asterisk (*) will fail.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask to use at run time. Mask must be a string composed of one or more of the masking elements, enumeration parts, or numeric ranges.
member.remarks: For a list of masking elements, see the Defining C1MaskedInput topic.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.HidePromptOnLeave
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the prompt characters in the input mask are hidden when the C1MaskedInput loses focus.
member.remarks: Returns true if PromptChar is hidden when the C1MaskedInput does not have focus; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.PasswordChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to be substituted for the actual input characters.
member.remarks: Mask property must be non-empty for the PasswordChar property to take effect. Another option is to set UseSystemPasswordChar, which will show all displayable characters as password chars.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.UseSystemPasswordChar
member.summary: Indicates if the displayable text in the control should appear as the default password character.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.PromptChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to represent the absence of user input in the control.
member.remarks: A prompt character is placed in editable positions that have not yet been assigned an input value. The default is an underscore (_).

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.ResetOnPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how an input character that matches the prompt character should be handled.
member.remarks: Returns true if the prompt character entered as input causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that the prompt character is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.ResetOnSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how a space input character should be handled.
member.remarks: Returns true if the space input character causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that it is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true. ResetOnSpace is useful when assigning text that was saved excluding the prompt, where the prompt is replaced with a space. Before restoring such a string, setting ResetOnSpace to True will reset the prompt characters at the positions occupied by spaces in the input string.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.ShowHintForEnumParts
member.summary: Specifies whether to show a hint with a list of available enumeration values for enumeration parts in the mask.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.SkipLiterals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to re-enter literal values.
member.remarks: Returns true to allow literals to be reentered; otherwise, false to prevent the user from overwriting literal characters. The default is true. Masks can contain literal and editable characters. If an attempt is made to add an input character to the position in a mask occupied by a literal, the value of the SkipLiterals property determines the result.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text as it is currently displayed to the user.
member.remarks: Returns text without any prompts and literals.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.TextWithPrompts
member.summary: Gets the text input by the user as well as any instances of the prompt character.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.TextWithPromptAndLiterals
member.summary: Gets the text input by the user as well as any literal characters defined in the mask and any instances of the prompt character.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.TextWithLiterals
member.summary: Gets the text input by the user as well as any literal characters defined in the mask.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1MaskedInput.InvalidInputColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to identify invalid input.
member.remarks: Property omitted if Color is Empty. Default value is Empty.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the C1DateInput class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the format pattern to display the date value.
member.remarks: The default value is d.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1DateInput.DateFormatResultPattern
member.summary: Gets the resulting format pattern used for Date values.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1DateInput.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the DateTime value.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1DateInput.StartYear
member.summary: This is the value of the starting year to be used for the smart input year calculation. If a single digit greater than '5' is entered, then the starting year is considered to be the year of the previous century.
member.remarks: Suppose the SmartInputMode property is set to True, and you set the StartYear property to '1900'. If the user enters a '5' in the C1DateInput control at run time, then the year will become '1/1/1951'. Suppose the StartYear is '2000' and a '5' is entered; then the year will become '2051'. The range for the StartYear is 100 years, so if the starting year is '1951', then the ending year will be '2050'. So if a '5' is entered and followed by '1', then it refers to the previous century; if it is followed by '0', then it refers to the current century.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1DateInput.NullText
member.summary: Text that will be displayed for null date.
member.remarks: The default value is "Enter value here".

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1Input.C1DateInput.ShowNullText
member.summary: Shows Null Text if the Date value is empty and the control loses its focus.
member.remarks: Minimal date "01.01.0001 00:00:00" used as null date. The default value is false.

member.name: T:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent
member.summary: Component that provides spell-checking services to controls and applications.
member.remarks:
The C1SpelChecker component supports three spell-checking modes:
Batch mode Use the CheckText(string), CheckWord, and GetSuggestions(string, int) methods to check strings and get lists of errors and spelling suggestions.
Dialog mode Use the CheckControl(ISpellCheckableEditor method to check the content of any TextBoxBase-derived controls using a modal dialog. The C1SpellChecker will check the text and display a dialog where the user can choose to correct or ignore each error. You can also check editors that do not derive from TextBoxBase. To do that, you have to create a wrapper class that implements the ISpellCheckableEditor interface.
As-you-type mode Set the extender property SpellCheck on any TextBoxBase-derived control to true, and the C1SpellChecker will monitor changes to the control. Any spelling mistakes will be indicated on the control by a red, wavy underline; right-clicking the errors will show a context menu with spelling suggestions. You can also provide as-you-type spelling support for editors that do not derive from TextBoxBase. To do that, you have to create a wrapper class that implements the ISpellCheckableRichEditor interface.
Dictionary Deployment
The C1SpellChecker component uses spelling dictionaries stored in files with a 'dct' extension.
To select which dictionary to use, use the MainDictionary property and set SpellDictionaryBase.FileName to the name of the file you want to use.
The easiest way to ensure the dictionary is deployed correctly is to add to your projects a reference to the dictionary file(s) you want to use, then set the Build Action property to None and the Copy to Output Directory property to Copy if newer. This way, the dictionaries will be copied to the output directory along with the application executable and the C1SpellChecker assembly.
When using this deployment method, make sure the main dictionary's SpellDictionaryBase.FileName value specifies a file name without a path. This way, the component will search for the dictionary in the directory where the C1SpellChecker assembly is located.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.MainDictionary
member.summary: Gets the main dictionary used for spell-checking.

remarks.para: This is the main dictionary. It is stored in a compressed format, and is read-only.

You can edit the spell dictionaries or create your own using the C1DictionaryEditor utility that ships with . This option can be useful for domain-specific applications that require the use of technical jargon (for example, medical, legal, and so on).
Users cannot add words to this dictionary, only to the .

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.UserDictionary
member.summary: Gets the user dictionary used for spell-checking.
member.remarks: This is the user dictionary. The user may add words to this dictionary using the spell-checking dialog, and it is automatically persisted to the specified file.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.CustomDictionary
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom spell-checking dictionary.
member.remarks: This property allows you to specify additional custom dictionaries to be used in addition to the standard and dictionaries.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.CustomParser
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom spell-checking parser.

remarks.para: This property allows you to specify a custom parser for breaking up text into words to be spell-checked.
For example, you may want to use a custom parser when checking source code files. This way you can spell-check the comments in the code and skip the actual code.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.IgnoreList
member.summary: Gets the list of words to ignore during spell-checking.

remarks.para: The list is used by the built-in spell dialog and by the as-you-type mechanism.
The user may add words to this list using the "Ignore All" button in the spell dialog or the "Ignore All" option in the as-you-type context menu.
Strings in the list are case-sensitive.

member.name: P:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.AutoReplaceList
member.summary: Gets a list of words and replacements to use while spell-checking.

remarks.para: This list is used by the built-in spell dialog and by the as-you-type mechanism.
The built-in spell dialog checks the list when it finds a misspelled word. If a match is found, the misspelled word is replaced with the corresponding list entry.
The as-you-type mechanism looks for matches whenever the user types a character that is not a letter or a digit. If a match is found, the text is replaced with the corresponding list entry.

Note the difference in operation between the two modes. In as-you-type spell-checking, any matches will be replaced, whether the key is spelled correctly or not. In dialog mode, keys that are spelled correctly will not be flagged as errors and therefore will not be replaced. For example, if the AutoReplaceList contains an entry with the strings ("attn.", "attention of"), then typing "attn. " into the editor will trigger a replacement and the editor will contain "attention of ". However, because "attn." is not a spelling error, the spell dialog will not replace instances of the string "attn." with "attention of".
The fires the event before making each automatic replacement. The event handler may cancel the replacement.
Strings in the list are case-sensitive.

member.name: E:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.BadWordFound
member.summary: Event that fires when a spelling error is found by the C1SpellChecker.
member.remarks: This event fires when the component detects a spelling error in a control. This happens while a spell dialog is displayed (see the CheckControl(ISpellCheckableEditor method) or while the component is painting the red wavy underlines that mark misspelled words in dynamic mode (see the SetSpellChecking method). The event parameters have a Dialog property that allow the handler to determine whether a spell dialog is being displayed or not. The event parameters also have a Cancel property that can be used to ignore the error.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.CheckCRC32
member.summary: Calculates a checksum value for the entry and compares it to the checksum that was stored when the entry was created.
member.returns: True if the checksum values match, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This method is used to check the integrity of the entries in the zip file. If the calculated checksum does not match the stored checksum, then either the zip file is corrupted or the program used to create the zip file is incompatible with C1Zip.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.CheckPassword
member.summary: Checks whether this can be read with the currently set password.
member.returns: True if the entry can be read with the current password, or if the entry is not encrypted.
member.remarks: This method is more efficient than using a try/catch block and trying to open the entry to determine whether the current password is valid for the entry.

member.remarks: The returned is a , which decompresses the data as it is read from the entry.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntryCollection.Add(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an entry to the current zip file.
member.param: Name of the file to add to the zip file.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.

remarks.para: By default, path names are not stored in the zip file. For example, adding the file "c:\temp\samples\readme.txt" to the zip file will create an entry called "readme.txt".

The parameter allows you to store one or more levels of the path in the entry name. For example, adding the file "c:\temp\samples\readme.txt" to the zip file with =1 will create an entry called "samples\readme.txt".

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntryCollection.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an entry to the current zip file.
member.param: Name of the file to add to the zip file.
Name of the new entry as stored in the zip file.
member.remarks: By default, entries in the zip file have the same name as the original (uncompressed) file. This method allows you to specify a different name, including a path for example.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing zip file.
member.param: The name of an existing zip file, including the path.

remarks.para: This method checks that the zip file exists and is a valid zip file, then reads the zip file directory into the collection. The zip file is then closed, and can be used by other applications. There is no need to close the zip file explicitly.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an empty zip file on disk.
member.param: The name of the zip file to create, including the path.
member.remarks: If a file by the same name already exists, it is deleted before the new one is created.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens an existing zip file stored in a stream.
member.param: that contains a zip file.

remarks.para: This method allows you to open and work with a zip file stored in a stream instead of in an actual file.
Typical usage scenarios for this are zip files stored as application resources or in binary database fields.

example.para: The example below loads information from a zip file stored in an embedded resource. To embed a zip file in an application, follow these steps:
1) Right-click the project node in Visual Studio, select the Add | Add Existing Item... menu option.
2) Select a zip file to add to the project as an embedded resource.
3) Select the newly added file and make sure the Build Action property is set to "Embedded Resource".

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Create(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new zip file in a stream.
member.param: that will contain the new zip file.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Close
member.summary: Resets all data members of the object.
member.remarks: Disk files are automatically closed by C1Zip. You only need to use this method if you want to break the connection between a class and a physical zip file.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes all data members by re-opening the current zip file.
member.remarks: This method is useful in instances where other applications may have changed the zip file and you want to make sure the information in the collection is up to date.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.OpenBatch
member.summary: Opens the zip file for multiple operations.

remarks.para: By default, opens and closes the zip file automatically whenever entries are added or removed.

This can cause delays in systems that have certain types of anti-virus software installed, or in situations where you want to add a large number of relatively small entries. In these cases, use the and methods to keep the zip file open until the entire operation is concluded.
Use a finally clause to ensure that the method is called even if an exception occurs.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.CloseBatch
member.summary: Closes a zip file after it was opened with a call to the method.
member.remarks: See the method for a complete description and a sample.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.FileName
member.summary: Gets the name of the current zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to use when adding or retrieving entries from the zip file.

remarks.para: If the property is set to a non-empty string, any entries added to the zip file will be encrypted and protected by the password. To extract these entries later, the same password must be used.
The password applies to all entries from the moment it is set. If you set the password to a non-empty string and then add several entries to the zip file, all entries will use the same password.

Although C1Zip supports Unicode characters in passwords, several popular zip utilities do not. To ensure your encrypted zip files can be opened with third-party utilities, use passwords that consist of ASCII characters only.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets a comment associated with the current zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level to use when adding entries to the zip file.
member.remarks: Higher compression settings create smaller files, but take longer to process. The default setting () provides a good trade-off between compression and speed.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Entries
member.summary: Gets a that contains the entries in the zip file.
member.remarks: The collection is used to enumerate the entries in the zip file, and also to add, remove, and expand entries.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.OverwriteReadOnly
member.summary: Determines whether the component should overwrite read-only files when extracting entries from the zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.OverwriteHidden
member.summary: Determines whether the component should overwrite hidden files when extracting entries from the zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.OverwriteSystem
member.summary: Determines whether the component should overwrite system files when extracting entries from the zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.MemoryThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the largest stream to be compressed in memory.

remarks.para: compresses entries into temporary streams before adding them to the zip file.
Entries with fewer than bytes are compressed using a temporary memory stream.
Entries with more than bytes are compressed using a temporary file. You can control the location of the temporary file using the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.TempFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the temporary file to use when adding entries to the zip file.
member.remarks: creates temporary streams while adding entries to a zip file. These temporary streams can be memory-based or disk-based, depending on the size of the entry and on the setting of the property. If a temporary file is used, you can control its location by setting the property. If you don't select a path for the temporary file, will create one automatically using the method.

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.ZipEncoding
member.summary:
Encoding used for entry names and comments
NOTE: this is culture-dependent, which is a really bad idea, but most zip packers use the default OEM code page to encode file names, so we have to go along with it...
Note that Encoding.Default seems like a logical choice but doesn't really work for international locales. Instead, we need to create an encoding using the current OEMCodePage. That allows accents and international characters to be used in file names (like the zip built into Windows, allows names such as "land.txt", "iti.txt", "Wrth.txt", etc.).
This has nothing to do with compression, it's just used to encode and decode entry names and comments.

Specifies whether the compressed stream should be compatible with zip files.

remarks.para: Streams in zip files are different from regular zlib streams in two aspects:
(1) zip streams do not contain any local header information (the information is stored in the zip file headers instead) and
(2) zip streams use a CRC32 checksum instead of the adler32 checksum used by zlib streams.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: The fields and must be initialized before by the caller.

inflateInit does not perform any decompression apart from reading the zlib header if present: data decompression is done by the method. Therefore, the next_in and avail_in may be modified, but next_out and avail_out are unchanged.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.param: Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Decompresses as much data as possible until the input buffer is exhausted or the output buffer is full.
member.param: How to flush data into the output buffer (default value is 2).
member.returns: Z_OK if some progress has been made (more input processed or more output produced), Z_STREAM_END if the end of the compressed data has been reached and all uncompressed output has been produced, Z_NEED_DICT if a preset dictionary is needed at this point, Z_DATA_ERROR if the input data was corrupted (input stream not conforming to the zlib format or incorrect checksum), Z_STREAM_ERROR if the stream structure was inconsistent (for example if next_in or next_out was null), Z_MEM_ERROR if there was not enough memory, Z_BUF_ERROR if no progress is possible or if there was not enough room in the output buffer when Z_FINISH is used.

remarks.para: inflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Decompress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in is updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to inflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. inflate provides as much output as possible, until there is no more input data or no more space in the output buffer.

Before the call to inflate, the application should ensure that at least one of the actions is possible, by providing more input and/or consuming more output, and updating the next_* and avail_* values accordingly.
If inflate returns Zero and avail_out == 0, it must be called again after making room in the output buffer because there might be more output pending.
The application can consume the uncompressed output when it wants, for example when the output buffer is full (avail_out == 0), or after each call of inflate.
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSync
member.summary: Skips invalid compressed data until a full flush point is found, or until all available input is skipped. No output is provided.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the decompression dictionary from the given uncompressed byte sequence.
member.param: Data in the dictionary.
Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after a call of if this call returned Z_NEED_DICT. The dictionary chosen by the compressor can be determined from the Adler32 value returned by this call to inflate.
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see the method).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses as much data as possible, and stops when the input buffer becomes empty or the output buffer becomes full.
member.param: Non-zero to force some data to be flushed into the output buffer.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: deflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Compress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in and avail_in are updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to deflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. This action is forced if the parameter is non zero. Forcing flush frequently degrades the compression ratio, so this parameter should be set only when necessary (in interactive applications). Some output may be provided even if flush is not set
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.
If deflate returns with avail_out == 0, this method must be called again with the same value of the parameter and more output space until the flush is complete (deflate returns with avail_out != 0).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateParams(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dynamically updates the compression level and compression strategy.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Compression strategy (0-2).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the compression dictionary from the given byte sequence without producing any compressed output.
member.param: Data in the dictionary.
Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after , before any call to .
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see ).

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStreamException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when reading or writing to a compressed stream fails.

member.summary: This is the default value. The tooltip is shown centered (with respect to the element height) and to the right of the element. If the browser edge is too close to the tooltip, then the tooltip will appear centered (with respect to the element height) to the left of the element.

member.summary: The tooltip is shown above the target element and to its left.

member.summary: The tooltip is centered above the target element.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolTip.Position.TopRight
member.summary: The tooltip is shown above the target element and to its right.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolTip.Position.MiddleLeft
member.summary: The tooltip is shown centered (with respect to the element height) and to the left of the target element.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolTip.Position.Center
member.summary: The tooltip is centered over the target element.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolTip.Position.MiddleRight
member.summary: The tooltip is shown centered (with respect to the element height) and to the right of the target element.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolTip.Position.BottomLeft
member.summary: The tooltip is shown below the target element and to its left.

member.summary: The tooltip is centered below the target element.

member.name: F:C1.Web.UI.Controls.C1ToolTip.Position.BottomRight
member.summary: The tooltip is shown below the target element and to its right.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.MappingCollectionBase`1.IdMapping
member.summary: Returns object for the property. If the storage object is bound to a data source via its DataSource property, the properties of this object allow the property to be bound to the appropriate field in the data source.
member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.
